item.title: About the Dentist
item.dc:creator: nordeldental
item.content:encoded:
Dr. Lenny Jung was born and raised in Vancouver, BC. He attended the University of British Columbia, completing his undergraduate degree (Chemistry & Biochemistry with Honours) and his Doctorate of Medical Dentistry (DMD). While in dental school, Dr. Jung was the recipient of the Mosby Scholarship Award for Scholastic Excellence for the year of 1982 - 1983. Dr. Jung began practicing dentistry in Delta and Surrey since 1985. What has always driven him is his passion to help with the oral health of his patients. He strives to understand each patient's story and treats them in a way that suits them best. Also, Dr. Jung routinely attends advanced training seminars and conferences to ensure he remains at the forefront of his profession. Most recently, Dr. Jung attended courses on:

- Invisalign ®, which enables him to straighten teeth without braces - Damon Orthodontic System - Occlusal Principles in Implant Prosthesis - Use of Rotary instruments in Endodontics

Dr. Jung is a member in good standing with the BC College of Dental Surgeons, the Canadian Dental Association and the BC Dental Association for nearly 30 years. In his spare time, Dr. Jung can be found travelling, playing ice hockey and gardening.

item.title: Welcome
item.dc:creator: nordeldental
item.content:encoded:
Welcome to the Practice of Dr. Lenny Jung at Nordel Crossing Dental Centre

Dr. Lenny Jung has been practicing and perfecting his skills in general dental care and cosmetic dentistry for nearly 30 years. He offers a range of dental options, including restorative dentistry, porcelain veneers, dental crowns, bridges and orthodontics.

item.title: FAQ
item.dc:creator: nordeldental
item.content:encoded:
Why do I need to have a routine checkup? How often should I go?

An interval of 6 months between oral examination is common for patients who are cavity prone and/or have gingivitis

It is important to have regular oral examinations to allow treatments to maintain optimal dental health. This will help to minimize the severe damage to teeth that would otherwise occurr in untreated cavities.

The frequency of checkups and cleanings depend on the likelihood of cavities, diligence of patient to oral care and gum health.

Why do I need to have an xray?

We will only give you an x-ray if we feel that it is absolutely crucial to your treatment. With our digital x-ray system, the amount of radiation you are exposed to is significantly less compared to traditional x-rays. We provide you with the most modern and safest x-ray protection equipment such as lead protection. Also, the smallest possible dosage of radiation is administered.

What is the proper way to maintain my teeth?

It is important to brush and floss your teeth at least once a day. Ensure that you remove the food between your teeth with the floss and brush in a small, circular motion. We recommend that you floss after eating.

Also, it is important that you do not snack too many times a day. Even the smallest sip of anything that contains sugar is considered a “snack”. It is recommended that you do not snack more than 4 times a day.

What are cavities?

Cavities are caused streptococcus mutans, a bacteria that normally resides in your mouth. Normally, this bacteria is harmless. However, if you snack too often, s.mutans will produce harmful waste products that will degrade your teeth. A tooth that is degraded to a large extent is known as a cavity. If cavities are not treated in a timely fashion, tooth fracture or diseased nerves may result.

What can I do about crooked teeth?

Crooked teeth can be fixed using Damon Systems™ and Insignia™, the most up-to-date orthodontics.

item.title: Our Technology
item.dc:creator: nordeldental
item.content:encoded:
Advancement in dental technology has helped to alleviate much of the stress associated with going to the dentist. Dr. Lenny Jung takes pride in keeping his dental practice on the forefront of technology. Digital X-Rays

Anyone worried about harmful radiation exposure as a result of standard X-Rays can be confident knowing Dr. Jung uses only digital X-Rays, which minimizes exposure to radiation.

DIAGNOdent® System

This system is the most accurate & efficient method of tooth decay and cavity detection available in modern dentistry.

Laser Dentistry

Laser dentistry is a form of dental treatment that utilizes a high-energy beam to complete both hard tissue and soft tissue treatments, including oral health and cosmetic dentistry procedures. It has proven to be less invasive, take less time to perform, be more precise, yield less pain and recuperation time, and can negate the use of stitches (sutures) or anesthesia when compared to traditional dentistry and the application of drills.

item.title: Treatments
item.dc:creator: nordeldental
item.content:encoded:
Health & Wellness

- Proflex and NTI antibruxism appliances - Periodontal Therapy (including sealing and gum surgery) - Tooth Removal and Root Canal therapy - General Pedriatric Dental Care - General Dental Treatment (including gold and silver amalgam fillings) - Counselling to minimize futures cavities

Cosmetic Dentistry

- Orthodontic Treatment using Damon and Insignia systems - Cosmetic veneers, porcelain crowns and white fillings - Bleaching and teeth whitening

Teeth Replacements

- Complete & partial dentures - Bridge and implant restoration - Iantec miniserow placement

item.title: Testimonials
item.dc:creator: nordeldental
item.content:encoded:
"I've been bringing my family to Dr. Jung since first moving to Surrey. He provides my two children with the same care and attention he would give his own. I also appreciate the fact that his hours of operation accommodate my busy schedule as a working mother, allowing me to come after work. Over the years we've built a real friendship with the staff and look forward to our visits." - MB

"I've never been happier with my new teeth! This was only made possible by Dr. Jung and his friendly staff's expertise on orthodontics. Thanks for giving me a new found confidence!" - MT

" Dr. Lenny Jung is a very patient and caring dentist. When I broke my teeth in a scooter accident a couple years ago, he was able to fix my teeth. Without him, my front teeth wouldn't have survived the accident. Currently, they are in great condition. He gives his patients quality dental care, and I really appreciate it." - RJ
